**GUJFLUOCHEM Q3FY26 | NEUTRAL, TP ‚Çπ3,580**

**Result Miss**  
- Consolidated EBITDA/revenue well below estimates on Fluoropolymers/Refrigerant weakness.  
- EBITDA margin ‚Üì140 bps YoY/587 bps QoQ to 24.2%; EBITDA/PAT ‚Üì7%/9% YoY.  
- 9MFY26 still robust: EBITDA/PAT ‚Üë16%/35% YoY.  
- Inventory days 201 (‚Üë from 182 QoQ); WC ~210 days; ‚Çπ170 Mn Labour Code hit.

**Segment Breakdown**  
- Fluoropolymers: Revenue ‚Üë14% YoY/-3% QoQ; lags 25% guidance amid tariffs/inventory; India-US deal aids outlook.  
- Refrigerants: R22 volume/price pressure + weak R125; R32 Phase 1 delayed to Q1FY27 (export focus).  
- Specialty: ‚Üì33% YoY on quotas/pricing.  
- Bulk: Revenue ‚Üë6% QoQ/-8% YoY (Chloromethanes/Caustic weakness).  
- EV/Battery: ‚Çπ30 Mn revenue, ‚Çπ80 Mn loss; IFC $50 Mn invested, $82 Mn sovereign approved; Oman greenfield + LiPF6/LFP scaling FY27-28.

**Forecast & Valuation**  
- FY25-28E CAGR: Revenue ~15%, EBITDA/APAT ~19%.  
- Margins to 27.4% FY28E; APAT growth 9.7/16.4/33.2% FY26-28E.  
- SOTP TP ‚Çπ3,580 (~7% upside from ‚Çπ3,360; 42x FY28E PE).

**Key Risks**  
- Battery chemicals/project delays.  
- Persistent commodity pricing pressure.

**Key Takeaway:** Weak Q3 masks 9M strength, but segment pressures cap near-term upside ahead of EV/Fluoropolymer inflection.

Ceigall India : Co. expands global footprint; Dubai step-down subsidiary incorporated

‚Ä¢ üåç Company‚Äôs step-down subsidiary Ceigall EPC Global Contracting LLC incorporated in Dubai (UAE) to focus on infrastructure contracting (roads, bridges, utilities, power projects). 

‚Ä¢ üèóÔ∏è Entity will undertake EPC & contracting works including buildings, roads, sewage, pipelines, bridges and power infrastructure. 

‚Ä¢ üí∞ Initial capital: AED 300,000, with 100% ownership held through its Singapore wholly-owned subsidiary. 

‚Ä¢ üåê Move supports international expansion strategy and opens access to Middle-East infrastructure opportunities.

üü¢ Impact: Positive
Global expansion improves growth visibility and strengthens overseas execution presence, though financial impact will depend on future project wins.

Alkem Labs Updates Saudi JV Structure; Partner Entity Replaced

‚Ä¢ üåç JV Structure Modified: Board approved amendment in Shareholders‚Äô Agreement for Saudi Arabia joint venture.

‚Ä¢ üîÑ Change in Partner Entity: JV partner‚Äôs wholly owned company Vitals Biotech Company will now hold 49% stake instead of the individual partner.

‚Ä¢ üè¢ Alkem Retains Control: Alkem Laboratories continues to hold 51% stake in the JV.

‚Ä¢ üìÑ Strategic Continuity: Change is structural in nature; JV plans and ownership split remain unchanged.

üü° Impact: Neutral
Primarily a structural amendment to JV ownership; no material operational or financial impact expected.

- Dividend/FCF yields hit crisis-era lows amid AI uncertainty.  
- "Discounted for extinction?" questions overblown.

- AI creates net new work areas, not displacement.

- Tech teams chronically underfunded vs. business needs.  
- AI acts as efficiency tool like past levers (offshore, cloud, software).  
- Services firms essential to deliver more with same budgets.

**Key Takeaway:** AI unlocks expansive work pipelines, positioning India IT for re-rating from beaten-down levels.

JPMorgan on IT Sector

Al fears driving a sharp correction

IT firms remain the plumbers of the technology world

Advances such as Claude code's Cowork plugin can meaningfully accelerate complex task

Agentic Al can write a lot more software

Definitely foresee partnerships among Al tool firms and IT Services firms that can create several new areas of work

Al will be another tool to address more work with the same budget like offshore labor, enterprise software, cloud have been in the past

Reverse DCF suggests that stocks bake in 4% terminal growth at current prices with no short term acceleration

Only case with >30% further downside is companies hit 0 terminal growth with no growth hereafter

Both these scenarios appear overly pessimistic to us given the new Al work streams emerging and the likely cyclical recovery

FCF/Div yields scream deep value and are crossing levels prior seen during market dislocation events such as GFC and COVID

Take a barbell approach to buy deep value in large caps

Overweight on INFOSYS, TCS, Persistent and Sagility

Q3FY26 Earnings Wrap: Broad-Based Beat with Smallcap Surge

Healthy Aggregate Growth  
- 456/500 top cos reported: Revenue +11.6% YoY  
- Adjusted PAT +15% YoY ‚Äì strong top & bottom line show  

PAT Momentum by Market Cap  
- Large Caps: +13%  
- Midcaps: +16%  
- Small Caps: +32% ‚Äì broader market firing on all cylinders  

Earnings Breadth Strong  
- 51% of universe delivered 15%+ growth  

Demand Recovery Underway  
- Leading indicators point to meaningful rebound  
- On-ground feedback from steel, cement, auto ancillaries, OEMs, pipes & discretionary shows steady improvement since mid-Dec  

US Trade Sentiment Lift  
- Positive turn in US trade deal mood adds tailwind  
- Encouraging signs ‚Äì watch for sustainability  

Key Takeaway: Solid 3QFY26 sets up broader market rally if demand holds.
The world is only as loud as you allow it to be. In the right light, everything becomes a masterpiece.

Rajeev Jain, CEO, Bajaj Finance, on Q3 Concall on the Impact of AI ‚Äì

‚ÄúAI listened to 2 Cr calls, converted voice to text, and gave us data. Text-to-data conversion happened for 5.2 lakh customers. As a result, we generated 100,000 new offers for which we did not have information earlier.

‚ÄúThis capability did not exist in Q1 and Q2. It just got deployed. We‚Äôll be able to listen to 100 million calls next year,‚Äù said Jain. He added that loan disbursements through AI-powered call centres stood at about Rs 1,600 crore. That‚Äôs ~ 10% of the Rs 16,545 Cr of disbursals in Q3FY26

Data converting -- data from those calls led to another INR 325 crores of volumes. So, this is just our first attempt.

Over the next six months, Bajaj Finance plans to invest heavily in its agents. The company expects to have more than 800 autonomous agents across sales, operations, HR, IT, risk, and DMS in the next fiscal.
Similarly, in terms of 100% of videos are now generated by us using AI, 100% of banners are generated using AI, 2.7 lakh videos were generated, and 1.2 lakh banners were generated. At the customer engagement level, we have 11 AI text BOTs that are live that engage with the customer. So rather than sending dumb SMSs for 11 products now, we have an AI text BOT, which allows you to engage, interact, and respond to your queries.

The company has 26 products. All 26 will be live between April and May'26. So, there will be no communication that we'll be sending, which will not have a -- whether service or sales, which will not have a conversational BOT embedded in it.

At the branch and point of sale, existing customers face match that we're doing, we did 46 million face matches to ensure this is the same customer, if it's an ETB customer who had actually principally come in, giving us much better control over identity.

Customer onboarding in terms of document -- ensuring that auto-fill of the document happens, whether it's a PAN card or an Aadhaar. There are 43 such documents that the company has now mapped, which an image extracts with a 95% - 96% accuracy and populate data in our platforms, delivering significant productivity for our employees.

Auto quality check of documents is now 41%. As we sharpen the model, it will take us to between 85% and 90% over a period of the next 15-odd months

On technology development, we are clearly seeing between 25% - 45% efficiencies emerging in terms of the development process, depending on whether it's a legacy platform, then the benefit is much lower, or rather, I would say, none. But if it's a digital infrastructure, then the efficiencies can be as high as 45% - 47%. So significant work is being done.

Src ‚Äì Q3 Concall, no reco

reports.text: Bernstein || India Quant Strategy: Where is investor crowding? What is being ignored?

RBI draft rules: banks must refund 100% for mis-selling‚Äîeven with customer consent. Suitability checks become mandatory, dark patterns banned, and complaints allowed within 30 days. Norms kick in July 1 after comments by Mar 4.
Most crowded Indian stocks by institutional investors (combined DII and FII ownership)

**SEPC: From Turnaround Story to Global EPC Growth Play**

‚Ä¢ Turnaround story: Company moved from debt stress phase to growth phase after resolution plan and capital infusion

‚Ä¢ Strong promoter backing: UAE based promoter gives capital strength and access to Middle East infrastructure markets

‚Ä¢ Debt reduction: ~80% debt reduced from ~‚Çπ907 Cr to ~‚Çπ182 Cr, targeting near zero term loan by FY26

‚Ä¢ Strong order book: ~‚Çπ4,500 Cr order book with majority international exposure

‚Ä¢ Export led shift: Increasing focus on high value global EPC projects vs small domestic contracts

‚Ä¢ Niche capabilities: Strong positioning in water EPC, trenchless technology, industrial EPC and deep shaft mining

‚Ä¢ Global growth visibility: Large projects in Saudi Arabia, Uzbekistan and other MENA regions

‚Ä¢ Balance sheet improving: Lower interest burden expected to improve profitability

‚Ä¢ Long execution track record: ‚Çπ28,000+ Cr projects executed historically

Join our WhatsApp Channel. üôèüèª

üëâ https://whatsapp.com/channel/0029VbBm3EiKWEKxIsMdoz2X

Free fall in IT stocks, Nifty ITüìâ

Nifty IT 5Y CAGR: ~5% (AI ü•∂)

Big issue with largecap IT CC growth wasn't coming
Many stocks have already seen huge de-rating
On FCF yield, they may look optically attractive
But if growth isn‚Äôt coming, cheap can stay cheap for a long time

Ashok Leyland IN Focus ‚Äì THREE DOWNGRADES

Morgan Stanley, Nomura and Investec

Nomura on Ashok Leyland
Downgrade to Neutral from Buy; Hike TP to Rs 218 from Rs 216

MS on Ashok Leyland
Downgrade to Equal-weight from Overweight; Hike TP to Rs 227 from Rs 160

Investec on Ashok Leyland
Downgrade to Hold from Buy; Hike TP to Rs 210 from Rs 185

Citi on Indian IT services 
Why is this cycle different (vs. Cloud/SaaS)?
Unlike the move to the Cloud, this AI shift has unique challenges:

Incumbency Risk: Indian IT has doubled in size since the Cloud era. It is now the "dominant player" being disrupted, rather than the strong challenger 

Cloud impacted infrastructure; AI impact is more pervasive 

New Rev streams are small, exploratory (not able to offset the loss in traditional work) 

Citi has a cautious view on the sector

**Lenskart in focus after a Morgan Stanley upgrade

Morgan Stanley lifts the stock to Overweight, raises target to ‚Çπ561, and hikes EPS estimates on strong Q3 growth.**

**MORGAN STANLEY ON BHEL | Overweight | Target ‚Çπ304 | TACTICAL BUY**  

**Near-Term Opportunity**  
- Expect share price rise over next 60 days  
- Use current correction to accumulate  

**Fundamentals Intact**  
- Underlying business remains strong  

**Order Book Momentum**  
- Benefiting from renewed coal order traction  
- Diversifying industrials business  

**Profit Trajectory**  
- New orders with better terms to boost profits from FY27  

**Key Takeaway:**  
MS sees **dip as buying opportunity** with strong order pipeline driving re-rating ahead.

SPEC: Engineering The Turnaround Phase Post Capital Infusion; Attractive Valuation Play

https://open.substack.com/pub/pulseofprofit/p/spec-engineering-the-turnaround-phase?utm_campaign=post-expanded-share&utm_medium=web

**MORGAN STANLEY ON ASHOK LEYLAND | Equal-Weight | Target ‚Çπ227 (from ‚Çπ160)**  

**3QFY26: In-Line, Margin Pressures**  
- Volume momentum intact but margins squeezed by product mix & commodities  
- Gross margin down ~50bps due to commodity costs  

**Mix & Pricing Dynamics**  
- ICV mix improved to 30%  
- Jan-26 price hike of ~60bps implemented  

**Valuation Limits Upside**  
- Sharp re-rating: EV/EBITDA ~16x (vs 11.5x Feb-25), near +1SD  
- EPS raised 12‚Äì19% FY26‚Äì28; peak margin capped at ~14%  

**Key Takeaway:**  
Morgan Stanley **downgrades to Equal-Weight** as much of the re-rating is already captured despite healthy volume trends.

**MOSL ON TITAN | Target ‚Çπ5,000 | BUY**  

**3QFY26: Strong Revenue Beat**  
- Consolidated revenue up 43% YoY  
- Delivered robust performance across segments  

**Jewelry Industry Outlook Positive**  
- Constructive on growth for top jewelry players  
- Titan stays competitive via exchange program & initiatives  

**Earnings Estimates Raised**  
- EPS estimates ‚Üë3‚Äì5% for FY27/FY28  
- Model CAGR: Sales 23%, EBITDA 25%, APAT 27% over FY25‚Äì28E  

**Key Takeaway:**  
MOSL bullish on **Titan's market leadership** and sustained growth momentum in organized jewelry space.

**MAHINDRA & MAHINDRA | BROKERAGE VIEWS**  

**Bernstein: Market Perform | TP ‚Çπ4,200**  
- Strong execution across Auto, Farm & subsidiaries  
- Benefits from EV policy, GST cuts, rural/infra spending  
- Improved capital allocation & cost discipline  
- "Everything works" phase ‚Äì momentum worth riding  

**CLSA: Outperform | TP ‚Çπ4,702 (Raised)**  
- UV revenue market leader with strong pipeline  
- Superior execution; EBITDA CAGR ~20% FY26‚Äì28  
- 3QFY26 Auto EBIT margin 9.5% (beat est. 9%)  
- Tractors: 7% growth FY27 post strong FY26  

**MOSL: Buy | TP ‚Çπ4,378 (from ‚Çπ4,521)**  
- 3Q earnings in line  
- FES margin ‚Üë210bps YoY to 20.2%; Auto flat at 9.5%  
- Revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR ~18%/18%/20% FY25‚Äì28  
- Well positioned to outperform in UVs & tractors  

**Key Takeaway:**  
**M&M in sweet spot** with multi-brokerage conviction on UV leadership, margin resilience and sector tailwinds.

@Fundamental3

**CITI ON UNITED BREWERIES | Target ‚Çπ1,650 | SELL**  

**3Q Volumes Decline**  
- Volumes down 1.3% YoY with premium segment showing weakness  

**Gross Margin Expansion**  
- Margins improved 220bps YoY to 45.3%  

**Margin Sustainability Concerns**  
- ~50% of margin gains may not sustain due to persistent barley and aluminium cost pressures  

**Near-Term Outlook Volatile**  
- Expect volatility in both volumes and margins in the near term  

**Key Takeaway:**  
CITI maintains **Sell** as volume weakness and questionable margin durability signal continued execution challenges ahead.

@Fundamental3

**CLSA ON HINDALCO | O-P | Target ‚Çπ1,035**  

**Near-Term Pressure from Novelis**  
- Stock may face pressure due to weak, one-off driven Novelis results  

**Adjusted EBITDA/t to Expand**  
- 3Q Novelis EBITDA/t at US$430; expect expansion in 4Q & beyond  
- Driven by no tariff impact, spread expansion, and cost savings  

**Reported Earnings Weighed Down**  
- EBITDA/PAT to remain pressured for 2+ quarters due to Oswego fire impact  

**Balance Sheet & FCF Challenges**  
- Delayed insurance recovery + ongoing capex to need US$200m equity infusion from parent  
- Higher working capital will further impact free cash flow  

**Key Takeaway:**  
CLSA stays **Outperform** as core operations improve, despite near-term one-offs clouding reported numbers.

@Fundamental3

**MOSL ON DIVI‚ÄôS LAB | Target ‚Çπ6,925 | NEUTRAL**  

**3QFY26: In-Line Performance, Margin Highs Achieved**  
- Financials largely in line with expectations  
- Reported **highest gross margin in 5 years at 63.7%**, driven by favorable product mix and currency gains  

**Earnings Outlook Stable**  
- Estimates for **FY26‚ÄìFY28** maintained  
- Expect **CAGR of 18%****/20****%****/21****%** in Revenue/EBITDA/PAT respectively  

**Key Takeaway:**  
MOSL stays **Neutral** as operational trends remain healthy, but valuations already capture the near-term upside despite commendable margin strength.

@Fundamental3

**MOSL ON GRASIM INDUSTRIES | Target ‚Çπ3,700 | BUY**  

**3QFY26: Profitability Beats Estimates**  
- Strong quarter driven by better-than-expected **VSF performance**  
- **Paints and B2B e-commerce** businesses delivered robust growth  

**Paints Business Outperforming Expectations**  
- Revenue and market share steadily improving over recent quarters  
- Positive market traction stronger than anticipated  

**Strategic Price Hike Implemented**  
- Recent **2‚Äì6% price increase** to test channel and consumer response  
- Indicates confidence in brand positioning and demand strength  

**Key Takeaway:**  
MOSL remains bullish on **Grasim‚Äôs multi-segment growth**, supported by solid execution, improving margins, and strong Paints momentum.

@Fundamental3

**CITI ON MAHINDRA & MAHINDRA | Target ‚Çπ4,230 | BUY**  

**3QFY26: Strong Performance, In-Line with Estimates**  
- EBITDA ‚Üë27% YoY, PAT ‚Üë33% YoY ‚Äî solid operating momentum maintained  
- Performance broadly matched expectations  

**Capacity Expansion on Track**  
- UV capacity ramp-up to 24‚Äì28k units/month by CY28  
- Expansion progressing as planned, supporting long-term growth  

**Tractor Outlook Turning Positive**  
- Early signs of replacement cycle revival  
- Tractor demand expected to strengthen in coming quarters  

**SUV & EV Pipeline Strengthening**  
- Strong SUV lineup to sustain growth visibility  
- EV project approvals progressing well, signaling future portfolio diversification  

**Key Takeaway:**  
CITI remains confident on **M&M‚Äôs growth trajectory**, citing robust execution, healthy demand trends, and a solid product pipeline.

@Fundamental3

**India‚Äôs PCB Powerhouse: Technical Leaders of 2026**

‚ÄãIndia's PCB sector is hitting its stride. **Kaynes Technology** leads with high-complexity HDI boards, while **Fine-Line Circuits** remains the backbone for ISRO's defense needs. **Amber Enterprises** (via Ascent) is scaling fast with massive 14+ layer mass production, turning India into a global hub for sophisticated electronic manufacturing.

While we often associate gold with glittering jewellery, the data reveals that in 2025, the biggest chunk of demand actually came from investors seeking a safe harbor for their wealth.

**FADA January 2026 Vehicle Retail Sales Data ‚Äì Telegram Ready**

**Headline**  
- **Total auto retail sales at 27.22 lakh units (+17.61% YoY)**, confirming strong start to the calendar year across most segments.

**Segment‚Äëwise breakdown**  
- **2W**: 18.53 lakh units (+20.82% YoY)  
- **PV**: 5.13 lakh units (+7.22% YoY)  
- **3W**: 1.27 lakh units (+18.80% YoY)  
- **CV**: 1.07 lakh units (+15.07% YoY)  
- **Tractors**: 1.15 lakh units (+22.89% YoY)  
- **Construction Equipment**: 6,834 units (‚Äë21.09% YoY)  

**Rural strength drivers**  
- Supported by **good harvest, wedding season, MSP hikes**, and **festivals like Pongal/Makar Sankranti**.  
- Rural demand remains a key growth engine for 2W, tractors, and entry PVs.

**Urban demand trends**  
- **Normalisation post‚Äëfestive buying**, with a **clear shift toward higher‚Äëvalue models** in PVs and premium 2Ws.  
- Indicates sustained upgrade cycle in urban/semi‚Äëurban markets.

**Key operating metrics**  
- **Inventory levels lean and healthy at 32‚Äì34 days**, reducing risk of forced discounts or pricing pressure.  
- **Digitalisation** is accelerating **enquiry‚Äëto‚Äëconversion cycles**, improving dealer efficiency.

**Near‚Äëterm outlook**  
- **Sustained demand visibility** across segments, tempered by **cautious optimism** and **segment‚Äëspecific recalibration** (e.g., CE facing high‚Äëbase pressure).  
- Focus on resolving **supply constraints** and **competitive pressures** to sustain retail momentum.  
- **Overall sentiment remains Positive**.

**One key takeaway**  
January FADA data validates a **multi‚Äësegment, multi‚Äëquarter upcycle** in auto retail, underpinned by rural resilience and urban upgrades, with lean inventories and positive outlook pointing to continued volume and earnings traction.

**MOTILAL OSWAL ON GSK PHARMA ‚Äì NEUTRAL, TP ‚Çπ2,700**

**Rating & target**  
- Maintain **Neutral** on GSK Pharma with a **target price of ‚Çπ2,700**.  
- View reflects decent operating momentum but already reasonable valuations.

**Performance highlights**  
- Recent quarter reported **in‚Äëline revenue** with the **highest quarterly EBITDA margin**, signalling mix and operating‚Äëleverage benefits.  
- **Oncology products in the specialty segment remain strong**, supported by **RUBY‚Äë1 portfolio** and the **scale‚Äëup of Zejula/Jemperli**.

**Earnings revisions**  
- Motilal Oswal **raises estimates by 5% for FY26, 2% for FY27, and 2% for FY28**, reflecting sustained specialty‚Äëproduct growth and margin stability.  
- Broker expects an **earnings CAGR of ~13% over FY26‚ÄìFY28**.

**Key takeaway**  
GSK Pharma is executing well in oncology and specialty medicines with healthy margins, but the Neutral stance suggests that much of the earnings‚Äëgrowth story is already priced in at current levels.

**MOTILAL OSWAL ON BOSCH ‚Äì NEUTRAL, TP ‚Çπ35,504**

**Rating & target**  
- Maintain **Neutral** on Bosch, revising target to **‚Çπ35,504** from ‚Çπ36,103.  
- View reflects a mix of near‚Äëterm misses and better medium‚Äëterm structuring.

**Earnings & segment performance**  
- Recent **earnings missed estimates**, driven by **weaker‚Äëthan‚Äëexpected performance in the non‚Äëauto segment**.  
- **Margins came in lower**, pressuring profitability versus consensus.

**Auto segment recovering**  
- **Auto‚Äësegment demand has picked up after GST 2.0 reforms** and is tailwinds for auto‚ÄëOEM suppliers.  
- Players like Bosch are **well‚Äëpositioned to benefit** from improved cycle and higher replacement‚Äëparts activity.

**Medium‚Äëterm growth outlook**  
- Motilal Oswal expects Bosch to post a **10% CAGR in revenue**, **12% CAGR in EBITDA**, and **14% CAGR in PAT over FY25‚ÄìFY28E**.  
- The upgrades factor in operating‚Äëleverage benefit once volumes and mix stabilise.

**Key takeaway**  
Near‚Äëterm pressure from non‚Äëauto is balanced by auto‚Äëcycle recovery and solid medium‚Äëterm earnings growth; Neutral rating is appropriate until margin and segment‚Äëmix risks clear further.

**MOTILAL OSWAL ON NSE ‚Äì Growth & Diversification Play**

**Strong volume momentum**  
- NSE seeing a **strong volume uptick**, underpinning transaction‚Äëdriven revenue.  
- **Transaction charges** dominate the revenue mix and grew **9% QoQ**.

**Revenue diversification progress**  
- **Listing services revenue up 26% QoQ**, reflecting the exchange‚Äôs push beyond pure trading income.  
- Mix is gradually broadening into other fee‚Äëbased and listing‚Äërelated streams.

**Earnings outlook**  
- Motilal Oswal raises **earnings estimates** to incorporate the current **strong volume run rate**.  
- Expects **15% CAGR in revenue**, **14% CAGR in EBITDA**, and **15% CAGR in reported PAT over FY26‚ÄìFY28**.

**Key takeaway**

**M M Forgings Ltd ‚Äì Earnings Inflection as CV Cycle Turns Favorable; Initiate BUY**

**Investment Thesis**  
- Equirus initiates **BUY** on MM Forgings with **Mar‚Äô27 target of ‚Çπ596** (CMP ~‚Çπ449 ‚Üí 33% upside)  
- View: early‚Äëcycle upturn in commercial vehicles (CVs) from FY27‚ÄìFY28 onwards, with strong margin and earnings leverage  
- Expect **Revenue / EBITDA / PAT CAGR of 13% / 21% / 36% over FY26‚ÄìFY28E**, with EBITDA margin rising from 17.3% in 1HFY26 to ~19.8% in FY28E  

**Macro & Sector Backdrop**  
- Indian automotive contributes ~7.1% to GDP; Indian forging market ~US$5.2bn in 2024, forecast to rise to ~US$10.2bn by 2033 at ~7.8% CAGR  
- Global forging market ~$80‚Äì90bn, growing at 5‚Äì6% CAGR, driven by automotive, industrial, aerospace, and energy plus demand for lightweight and high‚Äëstrength components  
- Indian CV industry had a weak FY25 (sales down 1.2%), but looks poised for a multi‚Äëyear upcycle; MMFG tilted toward MHCV and replacement‚Äëled domestic demand makes it a key beneficiary  

**Company & Business Model**  
- Founded in 1946; fully integrated forging and precision‚Äëcomponents manufacturer with ~145k TPA installed capacity  
- Supplies heavy components such as crankshafts, front axle beams, and knuckles to OEMs in CV, PV, tractor, and off‚Äëhighway segments  
- Domestic revenue carries ~80% of FY25 revenue (PV ~12%, agriculture & off‚Äëhighway ~8%); exports ~38%  

**Recent Performance & Earnings Inflection**  
- FY25 revenue down ~3% YoY to ~‚Çπ1,477 crore, weighed by soft domestic CV demand, US Class 8 slowdown, and muted steel pass‚Äëthrough  
- EBITDA margin expanded 103 bps YoY to 19.9% on higher machining mix (~58%) and cost efficiencies  
- 1HFY26 revenue down 4.1% YoY to ~‚Çπ727 crore; EBITDA margin moderated to 17.3% as peak capex cycled through  
- Net debt ~‚Çπ8.3 billion; with capex largely behind the company, cash flow and deleveraging are expected to improve from FY27  

**Growth Engines & Strategic Shifts**  
- Shift toward domestic MHCV and higher‚Äëvalue machined components: domestic revenue CAGR ~20% over FY18‚ÄìFY25 versus ~7% for exports  
- Machining mix rose from ~20% in FY16 to ~58% in FY25, targeted to reach 65‚Äì70%, with new orders skewed 90‚Äì95% to machined parts  
- Large capex cycle expanded capacity from ~65k TPA to ~145k TPA; utilization still only ~48% in FY25, leaving strong headroom for volume growth  
- World‚Äôs largest 16,500‚Äëton forging press (India‚Äôs first) expected to start contributing from FY27, with peak revenue contribution of ~‚Çπ300 crore annually and order book of ~‚Çπ300 crore (largely executable from FY27), implying ~‚Çπ500‚Äì700 crore incremental revenue potential over 2‚Äì3 years  

**Profitability & Valuation**  
- FY25 EBITDA ~‚Çπ294 crore on ~‚Çπ1,477 crore sales; recurring PAT ~‚Çπ136 crore, EPS ~‚Çπ28.2  
- Equirus forecasts FY26‚ÄìFY28E EBITDA rising from ~‚Çπ259 crore in FY26E to ~‚Çπ378 crore in FY28E, with EBITDA margin improving to ~19.8%  
- On the earnings ramp, **FY26E / FY27E forward P/E multiple is around 23.8x / 16.7x**, viewed as attractive given the cyclical upturn and margin expansion  

**Peer & Risk Perspective**  
- Equirus compares MMFG favorably with Bharat Forge, Ramkrishna Forgings, and Happy Forgings, emphasizing **earnings inflection, margin expansion, and deleveraging potential**  
- Key risks: high CV‚Äërevenue concentration (~80% of FY25), dependence on a limited set of global customers (top‚Äë10 ~58% of FY24 revenue), weaker US Class 8 demand, and lingering export headwinds; highly cyclical link to CV sales plus limited non‚Äëauto diversification  

**Key Takeaway:**  
MM Forgings is entering a favorable CV‚Äëcycle‚Äëdriven earnings inflection, with strong capacity headroom, a rising proportion of higher‚Äëmargin machined components, and a meaningful deleveraging story ahead, giving investors a leveraged play on India‚Äôs industrial and heavy‚Äëvehicle recovery.

**Costs & Asset Quality**  
- Opex Rs 307 bn (+6% YoY/-1% QoQ, -2% vs ests)  
  - Staff flat YoY/-4% QoQ; other opex +14% YoY/+2% QoQ  
- CIR **48.3%** (vs 55.1% 3QFY25, 49.3% 2Q)  
- Slippages Rs 49-50 bn (0.5% ann.); recoveries Rs 24 bn, write-offs Rs 51 bn  
- GNPA Rs 736 bn (1.57%, -3.4% QoQ/-12.7% YoY); NNPA 0.4%; coverage 76%  
- Credit cost 40 bps (net 17 bps); SMA-1/2 at 8 bps  
- CET1 12.6% (+10 bps QoQ); CAR 14.8% FY25 ‚Üí 13.5% FY28; LCR 138%  

**Subsidiaries & DuPont**  
- SBI Cards Rs 5.56 bn (+45% YoY/+25% QoQ)  
- SBI Funds Rs 8.26 bn (+52% YoY/+11% QoQ)  
- SBI Life Rs 5.77 bn (+5% YoY/+17% QoQ)  
- Cons PAT Rs 213 bn (+13% YoY/+1% QoQ)  
- Subs value Rs 229/share (post 20% holdco discount from Rs 286)  
- DuPont: revenue/assets 3.4%, core PPoP/assets 1.2-1.4%, provisions 0.2-0.3%  

**Valuation & Scenarios**  
- CMP Rs 1,066 (PE 12.7-11.9x, PB 1.8-1.4x; core PB 1.3x FY27)  
- Core Rs 837 + subs Rs 229 = CMP  
- **Base PT Rs 1,025** (1.2x core PB): 13-14% growth, 3.0% NIM, 50 bps credit  
- Bull Rs 1,635 (1.8x): faster growth/margins; Bear Rs 605 (0.7x): slowdown/NPLs  
- Concerns: deposit competition, CASA drift, NIM/credit normalization  

**Key Takeaway:**  
Excellent ops fully priced in; MS favors peers for superior risk-reward as NIM/credit costs mean-revert.

https://t.me/addlist/7yWSFQA7ITU2ODc1

**SBI Q3FY26: Strong Beat, Neutral Call**

**Profitability Surge**  
PAT hit **Rs 210 bn**, up 4% QoQ/25% YoY, beating expectations via stable NIM, robust non-interest income, controlled opex, and benign credit cost (~40 bps).  
RoA at **1.2%** tops 1% target; FY26E RoE pegged at **15.2%**.  
PPOP jumped **40% YoY** with 1.9% PPOP RoA.

**Growth Momentum**  
Loans accelerated to **6.1% QoQ/15.6% YoY**; FY26 guidance raised to **13-15% YoY**.  
Broad-based: SME +10.8% QoQ, corporate +7.6% QoQ, retail +4.4% QoQ.  
Deposits softer at **2% QoQ/9% YoY** (LDR ~81%), but pipeline strong.

**Stable Margins**  
NIM steady at **2.99%** (table: 2.93%) via higher LDR, lower funding costs.  
4Q NIM expected >**3%**, targeting ~**3%** through-cycle.

**Fee & Cost Control**  
Non-interest income soared **66% YoY/20% QoQ** to Rs 184 bn (fees +15.6% YoY).  
Opex at Rs 307 bn, down **1% QoQ**; CIR improved to **48.3%** (FY27 target <50%).

**Asset Quality Solid**  
GNPA **1.7%**, NNPA **0.4%** (both improved QoQ/YoY); slippages mid-40 bps.  
Gross NPAs down **3.4% QoQ**; PCR mid-70s.

**Valuation View**  
CET1 at **11%** adequate for 15% RoE.  
Target raised to **Rs 1,100** (from 1,050) at 1.2x FY27 PB/9x PE; **Neutral** rating on balanced risk-reward.

**Key Takeaway:**  
Operational strength intact, but valuation limits upside versus mid-cap PSBs.

https://t.me/addlist/7yWSFQA7ITU2ODc1

**RGL: D2C Pivot Powers Revival**  

**Sector Tailwinds**  
Gems & Jewellery faced sluggish demand from tariff overhang, but US-India trade improvement signals revival. RGL shines with strong US presence and rising D2C focus.  

**Strategic Shift**  
- Transitioning from B2B exporter to brand-led B2C platform.  
- Owned brands hit ‚Çπ18.7bn (FY24), targeting 36% CAGR to ~‚Çπ47.8bn by FY27.  
- D2C mix rising from 10% to 23%, boosting revenue quality and margins.  

**Premium Brands**  
- Jean Dousset (ethical luxury LGD) commands ~90% pricing premium.  
- NY boutique delivers ~25% RoI; store count to hit 5 by Jun‚Äô26.  

**Growth Projections**  
- EBITDA at 24% CAGR.  
- D2C margins expanding 5% to 18%; licensed brands at ~18%.  

**Investor Angle**  
Asset-light, high-margin D2C strategy ensures earnings visibility and re-rating. Valued at 8x FY27E earnings with significant upside as branded mix scales.  

**Key Takeaway:**  
RGL‚Äôs branded D2C acceleration positions it for strong re-rating amid sector recovery.

Nomura On India US Trade Deal

BROKERAGE RADAR

Welcome clarification of the fine-print of the trade deal agreed upon between India and the US

It should quell some of the uncertainty building in markets after the initial cheer of the deal

India's ability to stick to its red lines, particularly on agriculture, means that political opposition to the deal should be muted

Additional information regarding the removal of tariffs on gems & diamonds, aircraft parts and carve-outs of the sectors impacted by the Section 232 tariffs is a positive development for India

Purchase commitment of USD500bn over five years - whether these commitments are met or delayed remains to be seen

Nevertheless, this remains an important metric to track going forward

Bernstein On India US Trade Deal

BROKERAGE RADAR

The US and India treaty appears fairly constructive and it looks like a positive setup

Looks like a mature handling of the trade agreement from the US and India-which has been missing for a year now

Market euphoria was fading away leading to skepticism over how beneficial the deal is to India

This announcement clears up much of that, and sets the markets for a relief

Believe the fine print released so far is broadly positive for markets, especially for auto components and shields pharma from a potential negative

The economic costs of switching to far-off crude will also be outweighed by tariff benefits

Various other products such as textiles, gems and jewelry, organic chemicals, etc., where India has high exports to the US, will now face 18% duty vs 50% earlier; So this is a positive

However, there are not many direct and large stocks to invest in to play this benefit

Remain Neutral on India with a 28,100 Nifty target

Near-term short-term rally argument is for Nifty moving until 26,500, closer to where we started the year
